verses.kjv: The word of the LORD that came to Micah the Morasthite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
verses.web: LORD’s word that came to Micah the Morashtite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
verses.ct: This is the word of the LORD that came to Micah of Moresheth during the reigns of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah — a vision he received about Samaria and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Hear, all ye people; hearken, O earth, and all that therein is: and let the Lord GOD be witness against you, the LORD from his holy temple.
verses.web: Hear, you peoples, all of you. Listen, O earth, and all that is therein: and let the Lord LORD be witness against you, the Lord from his holy temple.
verses.ct: Listen, all you peoples! Pay attention, earth, and everyone in it! Let the Lord GOD himself be a witness against you — the LORD speaking from his holy temple.

verses.kjv: For, behold, the LORD cometh forth out of his place, and will come down, and tread upon the high places of the earth.
verses.web: For, behold, LORD comes out of his place, and will come down and tread on the high places of the earth.
verses.ct: Look! The LORD is coming out from his dwelling place. He will come down and trample the heights of the earth.

verses.kjv: And the mountains shall be molten under him, and the valleys shall be cleft, as wax before the fire, and as the waters that are poured down a steep place.
verses.web: The mountains melt under him, and the valleys split apart, like wax before the fire, like waters that are poured down a steep place.
verses.ct: The mountains will melt beneath him and the valleys will split apart — like wax before a fire, like water cascading down a cliff.

verses.kjv: For the transgression of Jacob is all this, and for the sins of the house of Israel. What is the transgression of Jacob? is it not Samaria? and what are the high places of Judah? are they not Jerusalem?
verses.web: “All this is for the disobedience of Jacob, and for the sins of the house of Israel. What is the disobedience of Jacob? Isn’t it Samaria? And what are the high places of Judah? Aren’t they Jerusalem?
verses.ct: All of this is because of Jacob's rebellion and the sins of the house of Israel. What is the source of Jacob's rebellion? Isn't it Samaria? And where are Judah's pagan shrines? Right there in Jerusalem!

verses.kjv: Therefore I will make Samaria as an heap of the field, and as plantings of a vineyard: and I will pour down the stones thereof into the valley, and I will discover the foundations thereof.
verses.web: Therefore I will make Samaria like a rubble heap of the field, like places for planting vineyards; and I will pour down its stones into the valley, and I will uncover its foundations.
verses.ct: "So I will turn Samaria into a pile of rubble in an open field, a place for planting vineyards. I will send her stones tumbling into the valley and strip her down to her foundations."

verses.kjv: And all the graven images thereof shall be beaten to pieces, and all the hires thereof shall be burned with the fire, and all the idols thereof will I lay desolate: for she gathered it of the hire of an harlot, and they shall return to the hire of an harlot.
verses.web: All her idols will be beaten to pieces, and all her temple gifts will be burned with fire, and all her images I will destroy; for of the hire of a prostitute has she gathered them, and to the hire of a prostitute shall they return.”
verses.ct: Every carved idol in the city will be smashed to pieces. Every gift earned through prostitution will be burned. I will destroy every image she has, because she collected her wealth through the wages of a prostitute, and to a prostitute's wages they will return.

verses.kjv: Therefore I will wail and howl, I will go stripped and naked: I will make a wailing like the dragons, and mourning as the owls.
verses.web: For this I will lament and wail; I will go stripped and naked; I will howl like the jackals, and moan like the daughters of owls.
verses.ct: Because of this, I will weep and wail. I will walk around stripped and barefoot. I will howl like the jackals and cry out like the ostriches.

verses.kjv: For her wound is incurable; for it is come unto Judah; he is come unto the gate of my people, even to Jerusalem.
verses.web: For her wounds are incurable; for it has come even to Judah. It reaches to the gate of my people, even to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Samaria's wound cannot be healed, and now the disaster has spread to Judah. It has reached the very gates of my people — all the way to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Declare ye it not at Gath, weep ye not at all: in the house of Aphrah roll thyself in the dust.
verses.web: Don’t tell it in Gath. Don’t weep at all. At Beth Ophrah I have rolled myself in the dust.
verses.ct: Don't announce it in Gath! Don't let them see you weep! In Beth Ophrah, roll in the dust in grief.

verses.kjv: Pass ye away, thou inhabitant of Saphir, having thy shame naked: the inhabitant of Zaanan came not forth in the mourning of Bethezel; he shall receive of you his standing.
verses.web: Pass on, inhabitant of Shaphir, in nakedness and shame. The inhabitant of Zaanan won’t come out. The wailing of Beth Ezel will take from you his protection.
verses.ct: March away in shame and nakedness, you people of Shaphir. The people of Zaanan won't dare come out. Beth Ezel is mourning, and its protection has been taken from you.

verses.kjv: For the inhabitant of Maroth waited carefully for good: but evil came down from the LORD unto the gate of Jerusalem.
verses.web: For the inhabitant of Maroth waits anxiously for good, because evil has come down from LORD to the gate of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: The people of Maroth wait desperately for relief, but disaster has come down from the LORD to the very gates of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: O thou inhabitant of Lachish, bind the chariot to the swift beast: she is the beginning of the sin to the daughter of Zion: for the transgressions of Israel were found in thee.
verses.web: Harness the chariot to the swift steed, inhabitant of Lachish. She was the beginning of sin to the daughter of Zion; For the transgressions of Israel were found in you.
verses.ct: Hitch your fastest horses to the chariots, people of Lachish! You were the starting point of sin for the daughter of Zion, because Israel's rebellions were found in you.

verses.kjv: Therefore shalt thou give presents to Moreshethgath: the houses of Achzib shall be a lie to the kings of Israel.
verses.web: Therefore you will give a parting gift to Moresheth Gath. The houses of Achzib will be a deceitful thing to the kings of Israel.
verses.ct: So you will send farewell gifts to Moresheth Gath. The town of Achzib will prove to be a disappointment to the kings of Israel.

verses.kjv: Yet will I bring an heir unto thee, O inhabitant of Mareshah: he shall come unto Adullam the glory of Israel.
verses.web: I will yet bring to you, inhabitant of Mareshah. He who is the glory of Israel will come to Adullam.
verses.ct: I will bring a conqueror against you, people of Mareshah. The glory of Israel will retreat all the way to Adullam.

verses.kjv: Make thee bald, and poll thee for thy delicate children; enlarge thy baldness as the eagle; for they are gone into captivity from thee.
verses.web: Shave your heads, and cut off your hair for the children of your delight. Enlarge your baldness like the vulture; for they have gone into captivity from you!
verses.ct: Shave your heads and cut off your hair in mourning for the children you love. Make yourselves as bald as a vulture, because your children have been taken from you into captivity.
